5.4.1 Management of primary prostate p: Offer multimodal and phenotypically directed treatment options for Primary Prostate Pain   Syndrome (PPPS).
Use antimicrobial therapy (quinolones or tetracyclines) over a minimum of six weeks in   treatment-naïve patients with a duration of PPPS less than one year.
Use α-blockers for patients with a duration of PPPS less than one year.
Offer high-dose oral pentosane polysulphate in PPPS.
Offer non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) in PPPS, but long-term side-effects   have to be considered.
